intro: Plectranthus nummularius, commonly known as the silverleaf plectranthus, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its oval, silver-gray leaves that are covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pale purple or white, which bloom in clusters during the summer months. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and containers. Due to its ornamental value and ease of care, it is widely cultivated in gardens around the world.
